cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.IR 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with the fundamental problem of semantic matching between two texts, which is a core area of natural language processing. Additionally, the paper proposes a novel deep learning architecture for this problem, which is a popular research area in cs.CL. 

The paper also involves the use of deep learning techniques, which makes it likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

Furthermore, the paper deals with the problem of determining the matching degree between two texts, which is a common task in the field of artificial intelligence. Therefore, it is also likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

The paper also involves the use of spatial RNN, which is a popular technique in the field of computer vision. Therefore, it is possible that the paper belongs to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CV (Computer Vision). 

Finally, the paper deals with the problem of semantic matching, which is a common task in the field of information retrieval. Therefore, it is also possible that the paper belongs to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
